hobby.message: Freestyle FPV drones still keeping you sane?
Still folding origami to stay grounded?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me - In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: No, just had to walk a bit further than usual.
Been rough getting anywhere with these system outages.
Tried to fit in some drone flying before coming here.
Not the best day for hobbies with everything disrupted.
Made it here, but detours everywhere—compliance stuff slowing things down.
Used to fly my FPV drone after work.
Security was tighter today, so I cut it short.
Signal’s been weird since the BCI fiasco.
Doesn’t make things easy.
No trouble, just a few more manual checks lately.
I fly freestyle FPV drones in abandoned zones—keeps me sane, honestly.
Was out near the south rail depot earlier.
All the BCI failures have messed up radio bands and patrol patterns.
Lost connection for a minute—nearly crashed my drone.
Still, got in a quick flight before coming here.
Getting around’s trickier—lots more ID checks since the BCI outage.
I always take my drone out before winding down. Freestyle FPV, nothing competitive.
Today some old wireless bands spiked—maybe because half the network’s broken.
Had to dodge more human patrols than usual at the depot.
Signal dropped hard behind some loaders, nearly lost all video feed.
That blackout weeks ago changed the whole rhythm out there.
Flying’s still the only time I don’t think about scores or missing people.
Honestly? Barely made it—compliance checks everywhere since Halden died.
I fly freestyle FPV drones. Not a secret, but I keep it out of the system.
Normally, abandoned industrial spots are quiet, but manual patrols messed up my entire route.
Last session, interference came from bands that should’ve been dead—BCI collapse changed the spectrum.
Almost lost my drone—signal loss like I haven’t seen in years.
Weird thing, the old network ‘ghosts’ reappeared on my headset, probably legacy errors.
After my brother vanished, the air’s the only place I switch off all the noise.
Even now, a five-minute flight clears my head more than any compliance program ever could.
hobby_answer: Yeah, still flying when I can.
Harder lately, access points keep changing.
Manual checks everywhere since the scoring mess.
Drone range is worse, too much interference.
I keep it simple now.
Yeah, drones are my thing.
Finding open airspace got tricky after the BCI outage.
Manual badge checks slowed everyone down, even off-grid.
Lost a quad last week—signal dropout, probably system interference.
Haven't seen patrols that persistent in years.
Feels riskier now.
Yeah, FPV is still my escape when I can get away.
Rail depot's not what it used to be—guards everywhere since the blackout.
Last weekend, interference nearly cost me my main rig.
BCI chaos messed with band allocations, even old frequencies.
Manual checks now, not just scans.
Whole city's on edge, even out where no one cares.
It’s not the same, but sometimes worth it.
Yeah, I still fly FPV—keeps me sane, honestly.
Not easy now with BCI in recovery mode—manual checkpoints hit my best spots.
Used to slip in unnoticed, but now I have to dodge guards, not just cameras.
Interference is wild—partial system returns messed with RF everywhere.
Lost contact mid-flight last time, had to recover the drone manually.
Caught a patrol sweeping wristbands—I almost got flagged for 'restricted activity.'
My scores dipped from all the rerouting and hesitation.
Still, for a few minutes up there, I forget about all this.
Yeah, drones are still my escape—been flying since before they tagged every public space.
Post-BCI collapse, even the old rail yard has guards and handwritten logs.
Used to tweak the system to stay invisible, now manual patrols just look right at you.
Partial restores triggered old jamming; one flight nearly bricked my backup receiver.
Manual compliance checks make hiding harder—last time, I pretended to debug my own wristband.
A couple points vanished from my score after that—probably flagged for 'anomaly.'
Feels like they're scrambling for hard control while everything's out of sync.
Almost lost my main quad—freaked me out; never happened before the outage.
Still, risk or not, flying gives me a silence nothing else does.
